definitions.definition: The change of something that is defective, broken, inefficient or otherwise negative, in order to correct or improve it
definitions.example: A major reform is needed to improve the efficiency in the factory.

definitions.definition: To put into a new and improved form or condition; to restore to a former good state, or bring from bad to good; to change from worse to better
definitions.example: 1909, H. G. Wells, The History of Mr. Polly Chapter 9

definitions.definition: To return to a good state; to amend or correct one's own character or habits
definitions.example: It is hoped that many criminals, upon being freed, will eventually reform.

definitions.definition: To form again or in a new configuration.
definitions.example: The regiment reformed after surviving the first attack.
